alert.note: Alert for Gwinnett (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:41AM EST until January 10 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Suwanee Creek at Suwanee affecting Gwinnett County. For the Suwanee Creek...including Suwanee...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Suwanee Creek at Suwanee. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor flooding expands along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at U S Highway 23 or Buford Highway. Most of the Suwanee Creek Greenway and trails are flooded from the Suwanee Creek Park to George Pierce Park. The minor flooding will also begin to affect portions of the playground area behind the Suwanee Elementary School. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 AM EST Wednesday was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 1.1 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.8 feet on 02/11/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued at 300 PM EST.this afternoon at 100 PM EST.
